little background about myself growing
up in Tennessee I was fortunate enough
to have a creek running through my
backyard so I was always outdoors
getting dirty in the woods flipping
rocks bringing snakes home much to my
mom's dismay she didn't like that you
know at all I think I was in the fourth
grade when I heard the word
herpetologist and I really understood
like wow you can actually do a lifelong
job and work with the things that I've
been going out and playing with this
whole time and that was that was great I
just I just loved it so I went to the
University of Tennessee and I graduated
with a degree in zoology after I
graduated I actually worked for the
University of Tennessee for about five
years in a reptile ethology lab now the
word ethology that means behavior so we
were checking out different types of
behaviors for different types of
reptiles and all that so I've brought
some friends here today to show you guys
